thread.title: Why Amazon and Google Haven’t Attacked Banks

author: Telis Demos
title: Why Amazon and Google Haven’t Attacked Banks
text:
Technology giants and big banks have been warily circling each other, especially in the payments arena. So far, they are more frenemies than rivals.
The reason: Banks are rapidly emerging as big potential customers for the fast-growing, cloud-computing businesses of Amazon.com Inc., Alphabet Inc., and Microsoft Corp. That is making technology companies think twice about alienating them by becoming direct competitors.
“We... RELATED VIDEO Is Amazon Going to Rule the World? Amazon wants to deliver everything you want to your doorstep, anywhere in the world. But the e-commerce giant faces several challenges in its pursuit of a global empire. WSJ's Karan Deep Singh breaks down the basics with the help of an Amazon delivery box.
